#Text=Iranian Azerbaijan
#Text=Iranian Azerbaijan
#Text=( Persian and Azerbaijani : آذربایجان ) is in the extreme northwest of Iran , by the border with the country and former Soviet Republic of Azerbaijan .
#Text=Provincial capitals
#Text=- capital of Ardabil province .
#Text=— the biggest economic hub of Northwestern Iran , the most populated city in Iranian Azerbaijan , and the capital of East Azerbaijan province .
#Text=— capital of West Azerbaijan province .
#Text=- capital of Zanjan province .
#Text=Other major cities
#Text=Jolfa - Border town with Nakhchivan exclave of Azerbaijan , but also a good base to visit the Armenian churches and the Aras Valley
#Text=- A good base for seeing the spectacular Babak Castle , and the Aras River Valley
#Text=— small village with houses carved in the rocks like in Cappadocia , Turkey
#Text=— Takht-e Soleyman , a Zoroastrian fire temple and a UNESCO World Heritage site , is located nearby
#Text=Other destinations
#Text=- A scenic valley on the northern border with stepped villages , mountain scenery , and ancient tombs
#Text=Understand
#Text=Iranian Azerbaijan is traditionally inhabited by Azeri people , an Iranian ethnic group that speaks a Turkic language , and Kurds , another group of Iranian peoples .
#Text=The region 's formation in its current borders dates back to Turkmanchay Treaty of 1828 .
#Text=By the treaty , Iran ( Persia ) ceded to Russia control of several Iranian Azerbaijani areas in the South Caucasus , which is now an independent country known as Azerbaijan Republic .
#Text=The boundary between Russian Empire and Iran ( Persia ) was set at the Aras river .
#Text=This region , especially eastern parts of it , is probably one of the most beautiful places in Iran .
#Text=The region is known for its friendly people , and also known for the great food .
#Text=Iranian Azerbaijan is comprised of four provinces : Ardabil , Zanjan , East Azerbaijan and West Azerbaijan .
#Text=Talk
#Text=Azeri people of Iran are mostly bilingual .
#Text=They are fluent in their native language , Azeri , and also the official language of Iran , Persian .
#Text=Kurds of this region , like most of Kurdish people in and out of Iran , can speak both Persian and Kurdish .
#Text=International airport
#Text=Tabriz International Airport is the only international airport in Iranian Azerbaijan .
#Text=It has flights to some Iranian cities and to neighboring countries .
#Text=Tabriz International Airport
#Text=( TBZ ) ( 10 km ftom the city center of Tabriz
#Text=) .
#Text=A regional hub with domestic flights to Tehran , Mashad , and some other major cities of Iran , and flights to some neighboring countries .
#Text=Domestic Airports
#Text=Urmia Airport
#Text=( OMH ) ( Northeast of Urmia .
#Text=) .
#Text=Ardabil Airport
#Text=( ADU ) ( Northeast of Ardabil
#Text=) .
#Text=Zanjan Airport
#Text=( JWN ) ( Northwest of Zanjan
#Text=) .
#Text=Sahand Airport
#Text=( ACP ) ( near Maragheh
#Text=) .
#Text=By car
#Text=By the bridge over the Urmia lake Tabriz is reachable from Urmia in 1.5 hours .
#Text=By train
#Text=Some of the Iranian Azerbaijan cities have access to the railway includingː Tabriz , Maraghe , Salmas , and Jolfa .
#Text=Tabriz Railway Station
#Text=, Rah-Aahn Sq . , Tabriz ( 5 km W of the city center of Tabriz
#Text=) .
#Text=Domestic trains : There are comfortable night trains from Tabriz to Tehran ( 12 hr travel , 152,500 rials for 1-way ) passing Maraghe ( 2 hr ) , Zanjan ( 9 hr ) and Qazvin .
#Text=There is a 2nd class sleeping train ( 6 people in one room ) that leaves Tabriz at 20:30 and arrives to Tehran at 09:30 .
#Text=Price is 40,000 rials .
#Text=The more comfortable choice is to take 1st class train for 170,000 rials .
#Text=This train leaves at 17:30 and arrives to Tehran at 06:00 .
#Text=There are 4-bed rooms with TV and dinner is included in that price .
#Text=To get the ticket you need to use some of travel agencies in the city or in the train station ( this option only for recent day registration ) .
#Text=There is a weekly train goes from Tehran to Istanbul which has a stop in Tabriz .
#Text=For more info visit Iranian Passenger Railway or Seat61 .
#Text=International trains : Weekly train to/from Istanbul , twice a week to Van , see Turkish Railway 's site .
#Text=By bus
#Text=There are bus lines from Provincial Capitals : Tabriz , Ardabil , Urmia , and Zanjan to major Iranian cities .
#Text=There are minibus lines for connecting the smaller cities to the provincial capitals of Iranian Azerbaijan .
#Text=Tabriz Main Bus Terminal
#Text=, Niyayesh Blvd. , Tabriz ( S 3 km of city center ) , ☏ +98-41 34796091 .
#Text=See
#Text=The UNESCO World Heritage site Armenian Monastic Ensembles of Iran .
#Text=It consists of three 7th century Armenian Christian buildings in the region — the monasteries of St. Thaddeus , St. Stepanos and the Chapel of Dzordzor .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Bonanb Kabab , a big skewer kabab with ingredient of local spices , onion and beef .
#Text=It is named after city Bonab in south of Tabriz .
#Text=Chelo-Kabab , a dish of rice with ground beef kabab .
#Text=Kofte-e-Tabrizi , a big meatball with ingredient of ground beef , rice , and herbd .
#Text=Lighvan cheese , a domestic feta cheese from Liqvan village in south east of Tabriz .
